title: Darwin Scaffold Studio: Q1-Level MicroCT and SEM Analysis Platform
description: Production-ready software for scaffold morphological analysis, parametric optimization, and mechanical properties prediction. Features include: (1) MicroCT and SEM image processing with Q1-validated metrics, (2) Interactive 3D visualization with Plotly, (3) Parametric scaffold optimization based on literature targets, (4) Mechanical properties prediction using Gibson-Ashby relations, (5) Cell viability analysis, (6) STL export for 3D printing. Validated against Murphy et al. 2010 (Biomaterials), Karageorgiou & Kaplan 2005, and Gibson & Ashby 1997. Includes landing page, documentation upload system, and Cloudflare Tunnel deployment for public access.

creators.name: Agourakis, Demetrios Chiuratto
creators.affiliation: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul (PUCRS)

references: Murphy CM, Haugh MG, O'Brien FJ. The effect of mean pore size on cell attachment, proliferation and migration in collagen-glycosaminoglycan scaffolds for bone tissue engineering. Biomaterials. 2010;31(3):461-466.
Karageorgiou V, Kaplan D. Porosity of 3D biomaterial scaffolds and osteogenesis. Biomaterials. 2005;26(27):5474-5491.
Gibson LJ, Ashby MF. Cellular Solids: Structure and Properties. 2nd ed. Cambridge University Press; 1997.
